meanings.sent1: Tom tried to fubs his friend by giving him fake lottery tickets.
meanings.sent2: She always fubs her way out of doing chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to fubs the dog out of its treat.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was skilled at fubbing unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to fubs the audience into believing he could make things disappear.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to that fubs; he doesn't know what he's talking about.
meanings.sent2: The class clown was known for being a lovable fubs.
meanings.sent3: The little fubs tripped over his own shoelaces and fell in the mud.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a fubs when she accidentally wore mismatched shoes to work.
meanings.sent5: The village was full of friendly fubs who always made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To bungle or mishandle a task.
meanings.sent1: Sarah managed to fubs the presentation by forgetting her notes.
meanings.sent2: He always seems to fubs things up whenever he tries to cook dinner.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter proceeded to fubs the order and spill drinks on the customers.
meanings.sent4: The actor tried not to fubs his lines during the live performance.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was nervous about fubbing the important project deadline.
